result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy C. Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant to be subject to random urinalysis testing.  

Contact with the victim to be determined by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Agent to evaluate defendant for participation in DV court.  Defendant to continue programming in domestic violence.

supervisions.notes: Sentenced to 90 days jail, deemed as time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy C. Hanson

records.addlTxt: document request

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears in custody in person without counsel present.  He states he spoke to his SPD attorney Thomas Huh in La Crosse regarding this case and he was going to contact the SPDO here.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Verified with SPDO in BRF that a public defender has not been appointed on this case.  Can re-call case later today if SPD can appear.  He is to call the SPDO immediately and see if they can represent him and do the hearing yet today before he goes back to La Crosse.  Re-call the case at 9:50.  Counsel SPD Anne Terrien is present with the defendant who is still in custody.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  No changes or corrections noted to revocation packet.  No victim issues in this case.  State recommends 90 days with sentence for 90 days time served.  Moves for civil judgment for any unpaid financial obligations.  Judge states there are none on this case.  SPD Terrien requests time served which he's served 97 days and the extra 7 days be available to his La Crosse case.  Court orders sentence of 90 days with credit for 90 days, time served.  No civil judgment.
sent ROAW to Judge this date.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
from DOC
FIDR destroyed.

Cheryl Sisco court reporter.  ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Fredrickson.   Defendant plead guilty to count 1 (repeater enhancer struck).  Court reviews plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  He understands. Attorney Fredrickson stipulates to a factual basis.  Court finds defendant's plea and waiver of constitutional rights is made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Factual basis found.  Find guilty of count 1 as amended. Joint recommendation for 18 months probation and conditions.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 18 months probation, with the following conditions:    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Seek and maintain employment.  Contact with the victim to be determined by the agent.   Subject to random UA's.  Agent to evaluate defendant for referral to DV court.  Continue programming in domestic violence.  CC
